info.title: TransitionZero API Gateway
info.description:
This is the API entrypoint to TransitionZero's open-access energy transition research platform.
This API gives programmatic access to all the functionality of the platform:
  - retrieve open-access asset-level and historical energy system data, free forever
  - dispatch system modelling analysis jobs
  - access premier research outputs by TransitionZero

# Authentication
A user account can be created [here](https://transitionzero.org/).
Please [get in touch](mailto:info@transitionzero.org) if you have any questions or requests for the platform!

get.description: Search nodes. Use 'includes' query parameter with a list of related resources,  eg. 'owner', 'aliases', 'records', 'asset_properties', 'node_type', 'parents', 'children', 'edges_out', 'edges_in' to also include their info in the response.It is also possible to use '.' notation eg 'model.owner' to include nested relationships.

Read node by slug. Use 'includes' query parameter with a list of related resources,  eg. 'owner', 'aliases', 'records', 'asset_properties', 'node_type', 'parents', 'children', 'edges_out', 'edges_in' to also include their info in the response.It is also possible to use '.' notation eg 'model.owner' to include nested relationships.

post.summary: Provide a list of node slugs to obtain a summary.
post.description:
Given a list of node slugs, return a summary:

**representative_nodes**: Given a list of nodes, representative_nodes picks out 3 nodes or less which are representative of that list. E.g.: [US-CA, US-TX, US-MO] -> [US-CA, US-TX, US-MO]; but [US-CA, US-TX, US-MO, US-MA] -> [USA]
**node_counts**: Count of nodes by type. E.g.: {"country": 3, "province": 1}

get.description: Search node_aliases. Use 'includes' query parameter with a list of related resources,  eg. 'owner', 'node' to also include their info in the response.It is also possible to use '.' notation eg 'model.owner' to include nested relationships.

Read node_alias by uuid. Use 'includes' query parameter with a list of related resources,  eg. 'owner', 'node' to also include their info in the response.It is also possible to use '.' notation eg 'model.owner' to include nested relationships.

post.summary: Bulk delete node_aliases with a list of uuids
post.description:
Bulk delete node_aliases with a list of uuids: If `continue_on_error` is True, the endpoint will try to process each resource in the request, capturing any errors and continuing to the next resource. The endpoint will always return a success status code. Use the response schema to determine which resources succeeded and which failed.
If `continue_on_error` is False, the endpoint will behave in an "all-or-nothing" manner. In case of error, the endpoint will roll back any db changes and return a failure status code.

post.summary: Bulk create assets with a file upload
post.description:
Bulk create assets with a file upload: If `continue_on_error` is True,
the endpoint will try to process each resource in the request,
capturing any errors and continuing to the next resource.
The endpoint will always return a success status code.
Use the response schema to determine which resources succeeded and which failed.
<b/r>If `continue_on_error` is False, the endpoint will behave in an "all-or-nothing" manner.
In case of error, the endpoint will roll back any db changes and return a failure status code.

tz__gateway__schemas__BulkCreateSuccess.title: BulkCreateSuccess
tz__gateway__schemas__BulkCreateSuccess.description:
Response schema for a resource created from a bulk create operation.

Args:
    uuid (uuid.UUID): The unique identifier of the created resource
    index (int | str | None): The unique identifer of the corresponding
        row in the CSV.
    ref (str | None): A human-readble unique reference of the created resource.
